p: From this study, S. aromaticum has more essential oils, fatty acid and other chemical components like trichloroacetic acid undec-2-enyl ester, 1,3, 12-nonadecatriene, Di (Z) hex-3-enyl phthalate2-methyl-Z,Z-3, 13-octadecadienol, 1-methyltricyclo [2.2.1.0 (1,6)] heptane, 1, 5-dimethyl-1-vinyl-4-hexenyl butyrate and 9-octadecenoic acid (Z)- 2,3-dihydroxypropyl ester not present in Jatropha curcas latex and D. tripetala, this could have been reason for its better antimicrobial activity. The study of Hossain et al. ( 2014) reported no bioactive activity of essential oil from S. aromaticum clove against P. aeruginosa, although, strong activity was observed against Staphylococcus spp. and E. coli.
